I DO NOT have a history of panic attacks, but I've experienced the very initial onset of them so I was aware of this building feeling. 19-24 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$2$4$"I took this medication at 100 mg for 2 years. It worked great in the since that I was made emotionally flat. Unlike other SSRI medications I was stable on it though.

column1: I went from a severe fluctuation between manic and depressive moods to being calm. Eventually I had no motivation to improve myself and was slowly wasting away. I would have been okay with every ending or just continuing as it was with no preference.

After getting off the drug my mood cycles are now very numbed and no longer effect my daily life. While weaning off the drug I was thrown back into a manic depressive hyperactive state. I got back on it and weaned off again 6 months later with success. Ever since I have had a low libido and tend to not want to do anything social. I still have mild bipolar like symptoms but I am working on improving myself now and have seen slow improvements since I got off the medication 3 years ago. I believe one day I will be normal again if I ever was to begin with."

column2: 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $5$4$5$"I've been taking Sertraline/Zoloft for 5 years to treat depression.

column1: I started at 25mg then to 50mg where I stayed for 3 years.

After a divorce I moved to 100mg for obvious reasons. For at least a year it seemed to do very well with crying episodes and overall getting through the divorce. Around the year mark the depression became much worse and I was extremely lethargic. I lost interest in everything
column2: including friends and family. I wouldn't go on dates and it was all I could do to go to work. The odd thing was that I seemingly had everything a single person would want. A lake house
column3: nice car
column4: great job and my choice of who I wanted to date.

column2: people close to me had no idea that I became a recluse. They all assumed I was having the time of my life.

column1: One morning I woke up and felt that I just couldn't take the pain anymore. I went to the kitchen
column2: leaned over the sink with a large knife to my throat. While trying to decide if it would be better to instead cut my wrist
column3: I stopped and called my doctor. I was surprised to hear her say to come right away to see her. When I drove to her office I was crying my eyes out because I hated who I had become. Thankfully my Dr didn't give up on me and actually up'd my dosage to 200mg. It honestly saved my life. I soon became depression free with the only side effect of still being lethargic. Also the dizzy brain zaps when I miss a dose.

column2: but always tired. My Dr. Has put me on a new medicine called Fetzima 20mg and has cut the Zoloft back to 100mg to help with the tiredness. So far so good after 3 weeks. I went through a few dizzy spells
column3: but stuck with it and feel like my old self again.

column1: If you or anyone you know has secluded themselves please know that there is hope.
The first step is having someone who understands your sickness and that you don't choose to feel this way.
The second step and hardest thing to do IMO is finding and then giving the medicine time to work.

column2: 35-44 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $5$4$3$I suffered severe anxiety and could not bring myself to go to work. Out of fear of being fired I went to my doc and was given Zoloft 50 mg. I felt so defeated. But within the first week began to feel better. I went back and had my dose raised to 75 mg the second week and was able to return to work. Still with some anxiety but no panic. Third week I went to 100 mg and on the 4th day had a panic attack at work. I took off a couple days and went back to 75 mg. third day I started to feel better again. I know we all want to feel better as soon as possible but more is not always better especially at first. I'm going to stay on this dose for a full 8 weeks before I reevaluate. It's very common to experience increased anxiety/insomnia when increasing. My experience is this med makes me wired for 12-15 hours then I crash. So taking it first thing in the morning with food is best for me. I tried splitting my dose 50 morning 25 in evening and felt like death the next morning. My sleep is still disturbed. I crash for 3 hours and wake up wired. Sometimes I can fall back to sleep. If I can't I take some zzzquil or smal dose of Xanax. But I'm terrified of benzos as the withdrawals are some of the worst I've been through. At only 3 weeks on this med today I can say I'm able to function again. I'll give another update in a few weeks when I've reached its full benefit.

161$Condition: Depression$11/19/2014 10:55:05 PM$Reviewer: Happy Enough, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $4$3$5$Zoloft was like a miracle pill for me.  My moodiness, irritability, sadness, and anxiousness are much more controlable and I feel like I can cope with life now.  However, it is not without side-effects.  The first 3 weeks I had diarrhea and headaches, but not major enough to stop trying it.  After a month, the cloud lifted and I started enjoying life again.  Six months later, though, other side effects such as loss of libido crept in.  I have never had a problem maintaining my weight, and have always had a fast metabolism. After  18 months on this drug I have gained 15 pounds (all within the last 6 months).  So, it's a tradeoff.  Life is not perfect, but it's good...

169$Condition: Panic Disorder$9/26/2014 3:19:06 PM$Reviewer: kammieholcomb, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $5$5$5$I'm 24 and have been taking Zoloft (sertraline) for 4 days now. I am so impressed with this medication! I needed it for my extreme social anxiety/panic attacks and depression. The first day I took one 25mg dose right before going to run errands and within 2 hours I had absolutely zero anxiety for the first time in my life. I felt a sense of euphoria and peace yet I was giddy/excited at the same time. I was able to make eye contact with people
column2: and not feel anxious talking to anyone. It was like I felt reassured and that nothing bad was gonna happen to me. As I was driving I was completely calm and I used to get all my panic attacks when driving! As for the depression that will probably take a couple months for the pill to build in my system
column3: but having no anxiety alone has made me an extremely happier person.

column1: As for the side effects I'm not going to sugar coat it in the least. I was not able to sleep for 4 days. My mind would race at night and I could not stop tossing and turning. Today I had my doctor prescribe me Hydroxyzene to help me sleep. (We'll see how that goes) It also makes my hands tremble to the point where people have asked me if I was ok. That has gone down quite a bit though. I have had slight appetite loss
column2: but am still able to eat normally. I have stayed at 150lbs for a year and today I weigh 145lbs. Kind of awesome. I have had a couple terrible bouts of diarrhea. And lastly I had to go buy a nightguard (mouthpiece) because I clench my teeth really bad at night now.
in regards to the side effects
column3: I think that it's just my body's way of getting used to it. Today is day 4 and most of the side effects are nearly gone. I recommend this med to anyone who suffers extreme anxiety. It zaps it right out of your body. It saved my life!!! "

210$Condition: Depression$4/24/2014 4:42:23 PM$Reviewer: Kate, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $4$4$4$I have struggled with an eating disorder, anxiety and very bad depression with suicidal thoughts for 4+ years. When I got to my lowest point I decided to try anti-depressants. Like most people, I was afraid that it would make me numb, emotionless, etc, but that didn't happen at all. I started out with 50mg a day. Once I had been taking them for a few weeks I already felt a difference in how I look at myself and other people (my family and boyfriend) noticed it too. Several months into taking Zoloft I hit a plateau. When I told my doctor that, she said that was very normal and upped my dosage to 100mg. The only negative side effect I have experienced is the night sweats ONCE IN A WHILE. Yes, they are uncomfortable and it's annoying to wake up feeling cold, but really clammy and sweaty, but the positive effects of the drug outweigh the negative sides in my opinion. My depression also interfered with my sleeping pattern. I would go through a couple days to a week or more of being so fatigued ALL the time and sleeping way more than I should, and then other times where I am so restless that I continuously toss and turn in bed and finally give up and just stay up all night. So, my doctor prescribed me Trazodone (helps with insomnia and is an anti-depressant) to take along with Zoloft. These two drugs together have worked very well for me regarding general depression symptoms, anxiety, insomnia, disordered eating, etc. 
211$Condition: Depression$4/22/2014 11:18:02 AM$Reviewer: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $3$1$5$I was given this drug in order to deal with the death of my fiance. Once I took it, I was emotionless. I could not cry to save my life. That is not how I want to feel. I need to release this hurt and now it is being blocked. I feel strange. I know that the need to cry is there, but by it being trapped, it is making me anxious and jittery. I am able to sleep, but when I awaken, I feel distant. I feel like my body is not mine. I am not sure what the intended effect of this medication is suppose to be, but I do not like the way it makes me feel. I was given 50mg and told to start off with 1/2 (25mg). The 25mg seems to be too much for me. The day of the funeral, I know I was being looked at because of my lack of tears. They just would not come out. I was like a zombie going through the motions. I am trying to get a hold of someone to see whether or not I am able to get on something more balancing. I feel as though I am about to have a panic attack. 
212$Condition: Panic Disorder$4/17/2014 7:37:04 PM$Reviewer: purplebttrfls, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $4$4$3$I had severe anxiety from the time I woke in the morning until I went to bed, also panic attacks through the day. I was in a very dark panic world and knew I needed help.  The doctor gave me Zoloft and I was afraid of taking pills so I started with only 1/2 of a 25mg pill for a week.  I increased it to 25mg a day and that's where I am for now.  I want people to read this and know it may not be pleasant when you first start an antidepressant but try to keep in mind it takes time.  I came back to these reviews quite a few times to read for my personal support to get through all the side effects.  I had every common side effect there is and some from the uncommon. I would wake in the morning and think ok what side effect will I have today. Most of them are gone, I still live with a few side effects, 2 of the most annoying are the twitching muscles and itching on the side of my face and neck but I will take them over the way I was living before. I also used Xanax to get me through the first 2 months of starting Zoloft. Zoloft helped my anxiety 95% and I hope it will continue to get better.  Today on my way home from work I found myself singing with the radio to a song and enjoying the sunshine, I have not felt like that in a very long time.  I hope this will be some ones support like others comments before me were mine.  Give it time to work.  And if Zoloft doesn't help you don't give up try another until you find that happiness again.

column2: 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $4$4$5$"Prescribed for panic attacks @ 50 mg with Xanax to get me over the rough spots until the Zoloft could kick in. column3: and I imagine that I was very 'suggestible' at that point
column4: so in short

column1: We tweaked the dosage for the first few months 50 => 100 => 75 while I worked on some other stress management techniques (exercise
column2: music
column3: turning *OFF* the TV news) after which I found that I could get by quite nicely at the original 50 mg / day.

column1: Over time I started feeling that while it smoothed out the low spots
column2: it also shaved off the peaks of my day to day experience. I was fully functional
column3: but while there were no horrors
column4: there were also no thrills. Then that 'fully functional' but not thrilling description started carrying over into my sex life and work experience
column5: too.

column1: So after about 14 months I just started tapering off my dose from 50/day to 25/day to 25 every other day to none. My demons didn't come back
column2: and I didn't have any ill effects from stopping. The Zoloft had done what my Dr. and I had hoped with no lasting collateral damage.

column1: Now after 3 years without any meds a very tumultuous year has brought me back to that edge. Knowing that you are having a panic attack is better than thinking you are having a heart attack
column2: but it does not make them any less intense. I started a new Zoloft script yesterday
column3: hopefully it works like last time. Hope this helps you! "

column4: and it was amazing; I felt calm and capable. Two weeks later my doctor upped my dosage from 50mg to 100 mg and advised me only to take the Lorazapam as needed. For two weeks I felt like I was having a psychotic episode
column5: while also feeling paralyzed
column6: as if I were in a straight jacket. I told my doctor this
column7: and he recommended to up my dosage again (150mg) and go back on the Lorazapam. I have been feeling extremely exhausted
column8: and don't have the desire to do anything. I am currently in grad school and am worried about how this will effect my performance. Already
column9: I feel completely behind. One benefit of this drug is that I haven't had any suicidal thoughts

column1: (though perhaps that's because I feel like I am in a straight jacket and incapable of doing anything?). Another benefit is that I've been able to interact normally in social situations and have finally begun to develop friendships within my program. Common side effects: I've been sweating a lot
column2: and I haven't been eating. It's actually difficult to eat sometimes
column3: and I have to force myself. I also haven't been sleeping that much
column4: and only do when I take the Lorazapam. My sex drive isn't as high as it used to be
column5: but I'm feeling as if that might be a good thing for the time being--who knows how I'll feel about that in a few months though. I'm going to continue with this treatment for now
column6: but can't say it's been that great so far. Crossing my fingers."

column2: 13-18 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$5$5$"The first time I took Zolaf I absolutely hated it... I was like great
column3: I'm on a drug that sounds like a sexually deprived wizard from w.o.w..... Jokes aside.....

column1: After being urged constantly by my psychologist to give it at least 2-4 weeks
column2: I finally agreed to give it another try; which was huge for me
column3: considering I was a skeptic on mood alternating drugs. I was recommended by my psychologist to take a quarter
column4: orally twice a day and then in 4 days do half orally twice a day. So then my body would slowly adjust
column5: for reduced symptoms. I was 16 when I first started so... yes I was young to be on some kind of anti-depressant. It's Been 2 1/2 months since
column6: and I'm so happy I gave it time to balance the chemicals in my brain instead of being impatient and expecting it to be a utopia the first day of use. It has helped me tremendously with social anxiety
column7: OCD
column8: and chronic depression. The side affects start to decrease around week two. Luckly I never had any of the serious side affects such as increased body weight
column9: insensitivity
column10: and the most dreaded of all a decrease of limbo. I only experienced the jitters and loss of body weight; which was a nice bonus of course. ;) so in the end... were all different chemically and emotionally so it may or may not be the drug for you
column11: but personally I'm on 150mg a day and so far... well it's been a huge help. "

319$Condition: Bipolar Depression$8/21/2013 1:40:52 AM$Reviewer: Happy Man, 19-24 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$5$5$I originally began with Celexa 10mg right when I graduated high school [when I decided to treat my severe depression].  At first, the Celexa worked for the first month, but then the benefits wore off relatively quickly.  Overall, the Celexa had generally low side-effect profile, it just made me lethargic at times.  After the Celexa, I was put on Lexapro [which is in fact the stereoisomer to Celexa]; however, I thought the Lexapro was absolutely ineffective.  Finally, I've been taking Zoloft for the past few months now and it is a miracle.  I haven't had an anxiety attack since I started it, my depression seems to have significantly faded, and I can do things normally again.  Again, this drug is fantastic, I have finally found personal contentment.  In brief, I had a mix of general bipolar, mild OCD, and moderate anxiety disorder.  In fact, I tried the Ativan as an icebreaker, but the Zoloft was actually more effective.  This drug--has worked my life wonders.

338$Condition: Panic Disorder$7/18/2013 9:47:56 PM$Reviewer: K4, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $5$5$5$I am male, 53 years old, & have now been on Zoloft (Sertraline) 75mg for 1 year. My problem was with anxiety, & I became very sick. I began by trying Celexa & it made me feel worse & very agitated. After 3 weeks I switched to Zoloft & about 2 days later I noticed an improvement & began feeling a little better - I woke up one morning with less of the usual symptoms of anxiety, & was also in a better mood & feeling happier (Zoloft is an anti-depressant). Everyone is different, & from my experience it does take about 3 to 4 weeks for the medication to really kick in & start working. After that, by the 3rd month I was feeling even better & the side effects really subsided & did go  away. So what to expect from the side effects? I had trouble sleeping & took 0.5mg of Atavan to relax me & fall asleep. It helped a lot, & after 3 months I did not need it anymore & my sleep pattern returned to normal. As for sex, there was really no problem, maybe a little bit longer to orgasm, but no need to worry about sexual dysfunction. As for alcohol, they say a little or none which is likely best, but I still drink the same & feel fine. A very noticeable side effect was sweating which came & went throughout the day. Also, I love the heat but was not as tolerant to it. You may gain a few pounds, but no serious weight gain. The good news is that as you continue to take Zoloft, you continue to feel better & better, & most everything eventually returns to normal. In my case, I now feel like I did before I ever experienced a problem with anxiety. As well, I feel much happier, in a good mood, and worry much less. This medication helps you to think sharper and more clearly rather than panicking. Your reasoning & ability to think logically is much stronger. A year ago I was counting the days to get off this medication...& now thank G-d, I wouldn't dare go off of it - I thought I would never say that! Good luck if you decide to try Zoloft, hoping you have the same positive result as I did.
339$Condition: Depression$7/15/2013 10:29:46 AM$Reviewer: dyslexicdog, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $5$5$5$I've had on-and-off clinical depression since childhood. In and out of therapists offices and hospitals, but I refused to take anything until my last hospital stint. Zoloft has changed my life! I feel like myself again, and a feeling of sadness may last an hour or two instead of a year or two without. I'm going to stay on this drug for the rest of my life. I haven't noticed any weight gain or other lasting side effects, although I did lose my appetite at first, all is well now.

column1: I went from being virtually house-bound for three years to being able to work a simple public job
column2: which had been impossible before. Zoloft erased most of my social anxiety within the span of six months
column3: although I still dislike overly crowded places and refuse to have friends outside of my family. This is an improvement on my previous disposition. However

column1: Before Zoloft I bottled every emotion and could not comprehend feelings -- while taking Zoloft I began to feel complex emotions such as anger for the first time. It improved me in some ways
column2: and I would recommend it to others with similar issues. It has enabled me to be extremely productive in some aspects
column3: such as being able to complete something with several steps in 2 minutes that would have taken me 20 minutes without medication. It also unfortunately removed my creative ability to write stories in my free time
column4: a career path I had originally hoped for. (Apparently I needed OCD to write!)

column1: After about a year of taking Zoloft
column2: I am not sure if my body has become saturated with it or not
column3: but it is not working right. Raising/lowering the dosage does not work to get rid of its side effects anymore. Now
column4: if my OCD routine gets disturbed or if I'm surprised/upset
column5: I either get a panic attack regardless of the zoloft in my system

column7: unable to move
column8: heavy-headed and unable to grasp or verbalize complex thoughts. This fuzzy-brain feeling lasts for about an hour or longer until I am able to calm down. It essentially makes me unable to work if a customer says something to upset me.

column1: I am talking to my doctor tomorrow about switching medications. Zoloft has helped me grow
column2: but it is no longer right for my specific situation."

424$Condition: Panic Disorder$1/19/2013 2:01:49 PM$Reviewer: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $1$1$5$After a trip to the er for a panic attack (at the time thinking it was a heart attack) my gen doc put me on zoloft 50mg.  I took it that evening and immediately had a reaction. I couldn't sleep
column2: couldn't stay still
column3: my whole body hurt
column4: I felt like I was literally burning up
column5: like my skin was actually on fire (although no fever) and the anxiety was through the roof. I also felt like I wasn't able to get my brain back in my head. I know that sounds weird
column6: but it was everywhere! I just huddled on the bed crying. Called the 24 hour pharmacist who said this was normal.  Called doc next morning who said the side effects should go away
column7: don't take another zoloft. About 5 hours later still unable to cope
column8: although the physical symptoms had passed the mental symptoms hadn't my doc said if I didn't get to the hospital he would call the ambulance.  I was then on a psych ward for 5 days trying to get 'back under control' I am now scared of ALL meds and only take Klonopin on a daily basis.  If you do try any of these SSRI's I suggest starting at a VERY low dose and building.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $3$1$5$I have PTSD from pulmonary embolisms that tried to kill me in March of 2012. I started taking Zoloft to help with the anxiety. I also have to take blood thinners forever due to the embolisms. After taking Zoloft for 6 days
column3: I got a red rash on my stomach -- it looked like a heat rash. Then I noticed a big ugly bruise on my calf -- about 4 inches x 3 inches. I know that Zoloft and my blood thinners can be a bad mix -- causing internal bleeding -- so I went to the ER. My blood tests came back okay and the doctor didn't seem too concerned with my red rash. I was told to continue the meds and go see my regular doc in a few days. I did
column4: and by then I was starting to get a 'rash' on my lower legs. My doc wasn't too concerned
column5: so I kept taking the meds as told. Then the spots on my legs got worse and started showing up on my back. I looked it up to see what it was
column6: and found out that it was peteciae (internal hemmoraging) leaving tiny bruises all over my legs. I called my doc and was told to stop the Zoloft. When I went to have my blood levels checked for my blood thinners a couple days later
column7: my blood was way too thin and I was at a risk of internal bleeding. I think Zoloft would have maybe worked better for me if my doctor and the coumadin clinic would have kept a closer eye on the drug interactions taking place -- and adjusting the blood thinners as needed. Although
column8: with the red rash on my stomach
column9: I was probably allergic to it
column10: anyway. So -- if you are on Coumadin or Warfarin -- be super careful about taking Zoloft!

column1: 426$Condition: Other$1/16/2013 5:32:25 AM$Reviewer: 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $5$5$5$I have been taking this Med for depression and social anxiety disorder and zoloft has just about been a miracle for me

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $5$5$5$"I have been struggling with post-partum depression since the birth of my child almost 8 months ago.  I initially refused medication because I was breastfeeding and worried it would affect my child.  I was very tired and sluggish all the time
column3: and had occasional bad days when I felt like I was just down in a hole and all I wanted to do was sleep.  Even on the best days I was chronically tired.  I often felt complete disinterest in my child
column4: and I lost interest in my hobbies- riding my horses seemed like too much work
column5: and I was way too tired to even consider exercising.

column1: I also had trouble with anxiety and feeling overwhelmed by even routine daily tasks.  I had a lot of irrational guilt as well.
Zoloft literally changed my life overnight.  I feel 100% normal
column2: the way I did before I ever got pregnant.  1 50mg zoloft a day has worked wonders.  I was afraid I'd feel doped up but all I feel is normal.  I have my normal energy level back
column3: I'm enjoying my baby
column4: I'm riding my horses again
column5: it's wonderful.

column1: I was afraid after reading the bad reviews that this medicine would give me bad side effects
column2: but so far  have not experienced any side effects at all.  I strongly encourage anyone suffering from depresion to give this medicine a chance- it might work just as well for you as it has for me.  I wish I had started taking it months ago.  "

508$Condition: Premenstrual Disorder with a State of Unhappiness$7/3/2012 4:26:16 PM$Reviewer: Poster Child, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $5$5$5$I began taking 12.5mg Zoloft just over a year ago for PMS and lingering, low-grade grief-related depression. I felt such relief that, I continued taking it every day and now take a very small, 25mg dose daily (I am a petite, sensitive person). I sleep better, wake feeling glad to be alive. My hormones no longer control my emotions and I respond rather than reacting to charged situations. I have no social anxiety (which I suffered before and which prevented me from going to some really fun places/events), I have not gained a single pound, can drink wine, live a normal life with no compromise and feel totally at peace. My Dr. says I am the 'poster child' for this drug. I will say however, that for the first, few months I was on the generic and had terrible gas and lose stools, also excessive underarm perspiration. Since going on the brand, those side effects have completely gone. It takes me a little longer to orgasm sometimes and my sex drive is slighty less, but it's a small price to pay for all the wonderful benefits of this med. At 46yrs old, I hope to take it through menopause and beyond, it has done nothing but help me to be my best, possible self.

514$Condition: Depression$6/21/2012 12:21:40 PM$Reviewer: ZoloftOKwithme, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $4$4$5$I've been on & off this med since 2007; it worked pretty well but had sexual side effects (libido/orgasm). It's hard to wean off of but I found that decreasing the dose very slowly helped. I could reduce to 50 mg with no problems and used that as my starting point. Then I would reduce the dosage by approximately 12.5 mg (by cutting the pills up) for each two-week stage. So it was 50 mg for 2 weeks, 37.5 mg for 2 weeks, 25 mg for 2 weeks,etc. I still had some dizziness but it wasn't quite as bad as when I followed the recommended protocol for weaning off!
515$Condition: Depression$6/19/2012 6:34:21 AM$Reviewer: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $1$1$1$This is the first anti depressant I ever took and my body's reaction to it should have been a warning for me against any meds. I took one pill, a very low dosage maybe 10mg, during a stay in a hospital psychiatric ward back in 2006. Soon after I began having very intense visual hallucinations. My doctor was notified at once and the medication stopped. He informed me that it was a rare, but serious, side effect of Zoloft and to never take it again because long term the hallucinations may become permanent. It seems my body is incredibly sensitive to psychiatric meds, especially anti depressants, as I have always had severe reactions to them. Eventually, I learned to work through my depression and anxiety and PTSD without the use of meds(therapy only) and am much happier now.

Zoloft helped me through the storm of the insurance claims which could have easily spiralled me into suicidal depression...I had to get a new job to pay for the costs of the accidents and on my job due to the complaints of my new manager about my frequent mistakes and inability to remember important job procedures, I almost lost my new job, and unfortunately that is still a looming possibility.  I just think Zolofts side effects are now causing the types of problems that cause my depression, so I am going to switch to Wellbutrin and see if my situation improves.  Zoloft has been my best medical friend, but maybe not.

560$Condition: Other$3/4/2012 8:53:21 PM$Reviewer: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $1$1$5$"After realizing how much i rely on these reviews i decided to write one myself in the hopes of helping everyone out there. I am a 22 year old female who went on zoloft to control my anxiety. i have had eating disorders in the past
column2: and after graduating from college i hit a point when i realized i had never fully dealt with those issues and was in a panic about starting my life. i began seeing a therapist who prescribed me 50 mg of zoloft daily.

column1: the results were terrible - but it was not until about 2 months on the drug that i finally realized what had been happening to me. i gained about 20 pounds in two months - not great for someone who has struggled with body image and whose source of anxiety is weight gain. i also felt extremely sluggish and had no energy. i could not stop my food cravings - i would eat
column2: and eat
column3: and had  no idea when i was full. finally i took myself off zoloft and with hard work lost the 20 pounds i had gained. i think part of this was an effort and part of htis was a NOTABLE decrease in my cravings and a regained ability to recognizing my body's signals. i also had increased energy.

column1: i am now considering going on prozac as i still have a pretty severe case of anxiety - i know zoloft may work for some people but wanted to write this review in case it helps someone else in my situation."

column1: 572$Condition: Panic Disorder$2/10/2012 11:02:34 AM$Reviewer: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $1$1$3$"PCP suggested this for what he thought was panic disorder.  I had been feeling ok most of the time
column2: but having debilitating panic attacks at random.  I felt comfortable trying an SSRI because I had had very good experience with Paxil 14 years earlier.

column1: I started the zoloft (generic for it) at 12.5mg and increased by 12.5 once a week until I was at 50mg.  Each time I increased
column2: the side effects (jitters
column3: nausea
column4: sleeplessness
column5: agitation
column6: dilated pupils) worsened.  My doctor convinced me to try a few weeks at 50mg.  The side effects continued
column7: and while I didn't have as many overt panic attacks
column8: I was in a constant state of anxiety and felt as though I was coming totally unglued emotionally and physically.

column2: going to 25mg for two nights
column3: then 12.5 for one
column4: then off completely.  I know that a slower taper is usually suggested
column5: but my doctor (and I) wanted me off quickly by that point.  I had no trouble with withdrawal
column6: which I assume (just my speculation
column7: I may be wrong) was because my body had clearly never adjusted to being on it in the first place.  "

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$5$5$"In 2008

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$5$5$"Used Zoloft for depression 5 yrs ago and found generic to make me very sleepy compared to brand back then (FOUND THERE IS A DEFINITE DIFFERENCE IN THIS DRUG BETWEEN GENERIC AND BRAND). Then NO MEDICAL INSUR and health clinic wouldn't prescribe BRAND had to pay $50/mth to get it SO COULDN'T and stopped cold turkey (DON'T REMEMBER ANY HORRIBLE WITHDRAWAL SYMPTOMS though). column3: lump in throat

column5: nervousness

THE DOSE FOR TREATING DEPRESSION IS 50mg so now on BRAND for last 2 weeks and have HAD TERRIBLE UPPER BACK PAINS AND SPASMS; right after took dose nightly got great ANXIETY but it subsided after an hour; NAUSEA right after dose (2 TUMS helps); has REDUCED my GREAT APPETITE (usually overeating is due to an imbalance in brain chemistry) and I'm able to make healthier choices at regular mealtimes (REDUCTION in impulsivity OCD); does help me SLEEP DEEPER at night (need at least 8 hrs)  but is DIFFICULT TO GET OUT OF BED in the morning (quick 1 cup of coffee and ready to go though); body PAINS I suffer from past injuries are EASED during the night which is a another welcome side effect not having to use additional meds.  I see alot of bad sexual side effects from other users reviews but I'm here to say

I also remember great euphoria effect from serotonin (that's what I'm aiming for again) can't say that has kicked in yet but do feel relief and LIFE SEEMS LIVABLE for someone who has battled depression/anxiety/OCD since late teens."

column2: 65-74 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$5$5$I have taken 200mg daily of Zoloft for three years to treat anxiety disorder. I tried many others before and nothing was as effective as Zoloft. My anxiety interfered significantly with my ability to carry out my usually stressful job and before Zoloft I would often leave work and walk furiously or even drive my car for miles until the anxiety subsided. Often I would resort to drinking a large amount of alcohol very quickly and sometimes this was mixed with Valium (usually 5mg X 2). Since taking Zoloft I have not had to use Valium once and my alcohol use has diminished significantly. The only negative I can think of is the possibility that my sex drive has diminished: that could well be caused by prostate issues which have recently been attanded to medically. However I am yet to recover full sexual drive. Perhaps I never will because of my age - 65. Having read a good many other reviews on this site I see that Zoloft does not suit everyone. It has though been of enormous benefit to me and for those it doesn't seem to work I just hope you find something that does: there is not much worse than severe anxiety/depression in my experience.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient) $4$2$4$"I have suffered from a mild form of depression since I was a teenager

column4: the Zoloft was the only thing that could be causing it.  If it was just five or ten pounds I could handle it
column5: but I increased exercise and cut down on food intake and I was still gaining
column6: and my doctor told me that it is a commom side effect and it would probably be very difficult for me to lose the weight while still on the medication.

column1: I'm now weaning off the Zoloft because I want to try managing the depression with vitamins (first try will be fish oil and a B-complex).  I don't mean to sound vain but the weight gain was making me depressed as well as uncomfortable in my clothes and my own skin!

I hope this is helpful for someone who is considering taking Zoloft for PMDD - I think it's worth exhausting other options before getting on it because of the weight gain.  But if I don't find the vitamins and supplements helping I will get back on it

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $1$1$1$I know each person is effected by medicines differently but I got absolutly no releif while on this drug. I am normally a very unorganized person and I'm pretty lazy at times. This drug just makes me really lazy and exhausted. I tremble all the time even on beta blockers and have very little motivation to get anything done. The withdrawl symptoms aren't too bad but I can still notice them a little. The only good thing about this medicine I can find is that it didn't cause me to balloon out like Paxil and Lexapro have. I would recommend it if you have mild depression or anxiety and gain weight easily but otherwise I think its awful.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$4$5$I've been on Zoloft on and off for 5+ years

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$5$5$"I have always suffered from menstrual triggered migraines.  But suddenly I was having daily headaches and eventually began to have almost daily feelings of lightheadedness (almost surreal feeling) to the point it was scary/difficult to drive.  My head always felt ""full"" and on overload.  This lasted a couple of months straight... so I finally visited the doctor.  After every possible blood test to ensure it was not my thyroid or other issue
column3: the doctor suggested Zoloft (25 mg).  I was hesitant because I certainly was not feeling depressed
column4: nor did I feel anxious or worried.  I had a promotion at work which had me working more hours and juggling kids/home more
column5: but I didn't feel overly stressed... at least felt I was handling it.  Nevertheless
column6: after 1 week on Zoloft the headaches and dizziness disappeared.  I began to feel much better
column7: more like myself with a clearer head.  I had felt yucky for several weeks
column8: it was such a relief!  After 2 weeks on Zoloft
column9: I went off it.  Within 4 days
column10: the headaches returned and each day I almost felt worse... my fear was I was gradually slipping back to how I felt previously.  The doctor suggested I continue taking Zoloft at only 12.5 mg. for a couple of months and wean myself off.  She said it is not uncommon for someone to need it for a few months
column11: go off it and never need to take again.  I am hopeful I am in that category as I adamant that I want to be med-free if possible.  I have had no side effects.  As someone else posted on here
column12: I think my sexual desire has INCREASED
column13: likely because I am feeling better!  I hope sharing my experience helps you. "

column1:
1017$Condition: Depression$7/22/2010 12:39:55 PM$Reviewer: balancedbrain, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $4$4$4$I am a 67 year old woman. Depression runs in my family. I have taken zoloft twice for depression in the last four years. (I do not suffer from anxiety attacks.) It has worked both times, though it takes awhile. The first few weeks it improves the quality of my sleep, and then it gradually lifts my mood until I am almost) my old cheery self. I am thankful for zoloft.  However, I have experienced some side effects:  first and foremost, diarrhea - which has slowed over time but still have some stomach irritation. (At one point the pharmacy switched generics and the diarrhea stopped completely.) Also, it has reduced my sex drive and ability to orgasm - my doc suggested I take a break from zoloft on the weekends and that has helped.(This could be a worse problem for younger couples with a more spontaneous sex life, but it works for us.) I have NOT experienced nausea, skin outbreaks, tremors. I am pleased with zoloft and feel fortunate that it has worked for me. It has helped my brother and my dad too. From reading the reviews, it seems that it is not as helpful for depression with anxiety. Also, I recommend patience when you first start taking it - it takes awhile to get the full benefit. I have recently added fish oil and aerobic exercise (Curves three days a week for 1/2 an hour) - and make sure I get as much light and sunshine as possible. It is important to socialize too - even if you have to force yourself. Good luck to all of you.

column1: 1075$Condition: Depression$5/19/2010 10:09:32 PM$Reviewer: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $4$4$5$Side effects lasted about a week and then were completely gone.  Worked great initially.  I became calm (no more flying off the handle) enjoyed my kids so much and they me and my social anxiety was mostly gone.  I stayed on it through my first 2 trimesters of pregnancy and went off for the last (had many panic attacks of feeling that I wasn't able to breathe
column2: partly because of pregnancy and magnified by stopping Zoloft cold turkey.)  Went back on it 3 weeks after daughter was born but it just never worked as well as it did previously.  I eventually started feeling very foggy and started having short term memory problems.  Adding 5htp and tyrosine helped.  The big thing too my appetite started getting out of control... thought about food constantly and craved sweets all the time which caused me to gain 10 lbs.  Went off of 50 mg cold turkey.  Have been off of it about 2.5 months.  Has been tough and very on and off.  Started taking 5htp and tyrosine and starting to feel more leveled out.  I read that long term Zoloft use can affect your metabolism.  I'm hoping I can lose some weight and won't hesitate to try antidepressants again if I really need them (hope I can lose some weight first though..) Great at first
column3: but long term can have a weight gain a foggy thinking effect. Eventually would probably have to be enhanced by Wellbutrin or Ambilify especially with the foggy thinking.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years$5$5$5$"I starting taking Zoloft about 6 months after my first child was born for severe anxiety (which runs in the family). I thought it was post partum & the Gyno told me to take a yoga class to relax ~ could you imagine??? There was a positive major difference in my mood while on it. I was finally able to sleep through the night!!! I stopped them prior to getting pregnant with my second child for fear of what it would do to the fetus even though the doctors all told me it would be o.k. I have now been taking the generic form of Zoloft for about 2 years and would not have it any other way!!! I started taking 50 mg per day
column3: then increased it to 75mg. There is a marked difference in the way I handle everyday life ~ much easier to cope. Life these days is not that easy ~ I have 2 children with ADHD & 1 of them also has severe anxiety. One is on Adderall
column4: which is working wonderfully & the other is on Prozac ~ so far. Can't get him to take a non-stimulant ADHD med & the stimulants are are making his anxiety worse. My husband was also laid off 15 months ago!!! Has that for stress?? If it weren't for these pills I would go crazy for sure.

column1: The only side effects are a little weight gain ~ doesn't matter I only weigh 125 now & I find I have a lack of desire in the sexual area ~ a drink helps that!!

For all of you that are living your lives in stress believe me it is not worth it. Try these meds & see the difference ~ the worst thing that can happen is you have to stop them. If you had high blood pressure or diabetes would you take medication for it? Stop thinking that you are crazy and get yourselves the medication that you need to function.....Good Luck"

45-54 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $1$1$5$I feel like the odd man out as most reviews of Zoloft seem to be very positive. I'm not knocking the drug
column3: but have to report on my experiences with it; they were awful. About one week after treatment on 50mg
column4: I started developing tremor and felt very agitated. The jitters were bad---feeling like I'd just drunk 5 cups of coffee. Side effects worsened and after 3 weeks
column5: I experienced really bad anxiety
column6: like nothing I'd ever experienced before. It was as if a part of my mind was spinning out of control and I was helpless to do anything about it. It was clearly a bad reaction to sertraline because I've never in my 53 years experienced that type of bizarre anxiety. I know full well what panic attacks are
column7: and I've dealt with varying degrees of anxiety for decades. But this was completely new to me and scared the living hell out of me.  After switching to Celexa
column8: my side effects almost immediately abated and my depression lifted within several weeks of therapy. So the moral of the story
column9: obviously
column10: is that everyone's brain receptors work differently
column11: there is no test to determine the best drugs for those receptors
column12: and so careful monitoring and switching of drugs when called for is the best and only course of action.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $5$5$5$"Wow. Zoloft saved my marriage.  Before I developed severe PMS
column3: I would have never
column4: ever considered taking any mood-altering medication.  I believed the common misperception about these being ""happy pills.""  After the birth of my first child and the return of my menstrual period
column5: one week per month became pure hell.  I was snappish
column6: rude
column7: and angry-and I didn't even realize I was doing it.  I was desperate to be myself again.  After 6 months of misery
column8: I decided to try Zoloft.  I started my prescription (50 mg per day) the day before my PMS week started.  There was a 36 hour time period where I felt a little sleepy and woozy
column9: with mild stomach upset and dry mouth.  After that
column10: I felt normal except for occasional dry mouth.  And my emotional PMS symptoms?  GONE!  Completely gone!  Even the physical symptoms abated.  I used to feel like I had the flu during the week before my period (body aches
column11: extreme fatigue)
column12: but no more.  I don't feel anxious or on edge.  I don't feel ""giddy
column13: either; I just feel normal.  So I'll be starting my Zoloft pills the day before my premenstrual week begins
column14: and continuing them until my flow starts."

column2: 13-18 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $1$1$5$I am 17 years old. I started using opiate painkillers at age 14 and injecting opiates iv including heroin when I was 16. I tried to get off of opiates for 6 months by myself and finally decided to see a shrink. I was very depressed without opiates scaled 8/10 and anxiety on a level of 11/10. The shrink put me on zolft 50 for withdrawls and did nothing the first 2 days. on the third day of taking zoloft I got terrible cold sweats (along with opiate withdrawl cold sweats)
column3: and was sleeping less then before. I began getting 2 hours of sleep max
column4: and I felt like a zombie. about 5 days after I stoped opiates
column5: and started zoloft I started on suboxone (which is specifically for opiate withdrawls). my depression seemed to get better but I was still a zombie and was still very anxious. I stopped taking zolft after about a month and just taking suboxone. my depression and anxiety disapeared aswell as my night sweats and sleep problems. but the withdrawls from zolft were very scary and would creep up on me. all of the sudded I would get a crazy tingle down my arms and through my hands
column6: I would get these 'brain zaps'like an electrical shock through my brain where I would blurt weird noises unintentionally. I would get about 10 'brain zaps' a day and were very very frightening. the brain zaps slowly disapated but I stil get them when falling asleep maybe once or twice a week. I have been off zolft for 2 months now and i am still having withdrawls. I will never take an anti-depressant again EVER! Beware of this med. YOU GET WHAT YOU PAY FOR!

column3: but I could only afford it for a short time. After talking with my dr. she agreed that I should get back on it and they offered a generic version that was less expensive. At first it made me sleepy a little nausaus but it soon went away. I have lost about 8 lbs on it
column4: but I am also still losing baby weight and work out everyday. It definitely supresses my appetite. The only bad thing is that about 8 oclock at night its like the effects start wearing off and I am hungry. I have to control my urge to eat late at night. It has not decreased my sexual desire at all. If anything it has increased it. I guess because my husband and I aren't fighting as much and I am much happier. I love this medicine!

25-34 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient) $5$5$5$Great drug. It took 2 months to take full effect.  I am currently on 100mg in the morning plus clanezapam at .25mg in the morning and afternoon.  My depression kicked in the summer of 2008 when I moved to a new home and started a high stress job that I did not choose.  On top of that I was diagnosed with a heart condition that will most likely result in a valve replacement surgery down the road. I also went through about 2-3 months of therapy.  I am a totally different person today.  I was never socially active and I was having frequent panic attacks.  It is strange when you look back at it how you are in a deep hole and you fear that you will never get your life back.  I have gotten my life back with the help of Zoloft.  I highly recommend it to anyone suffering the same issues. You have to have faith and belief that you will overcome your depression.  It was hard at first getting out to do normal everyday things.  I forced myself to get out and do chores outside and my family was a great help.  I did try other drugs at first and Zoloft was my life saver. I plan an taking the rest of my life because I never want to be the person I was before

25-34 Male  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $4$3$5$"This is a great drug for depression and anxiety but if you ever want to have a orgasm again without popping a vessel in your head by trying so hard
column3: good luck. I took 100mg of Zoloft for seven years and for the most part felt great. The only side affect for me was how my doctor put it ""I couldn't get mt ticket punched during sex"". This simply would not do for me. Coming off the drug is difficult but can be done. Just ween yourself each week you are taking it to smaller doses by cutting the pills. You will get an strong feeling of dizziness and disorientation but it does pass within a short time. Maybe 2 weeks or so. Once u get past that point u will be fine. I now take Wellbutrin which does everything the Zoloft did minus the sexual side affect. Good luck people and if u want off this drug it isn't easy but it can be done. Just hang in there. I'm really proud of everyone who are taking steps to make their life happy and fulfilling for them and their family.

column1: Oh one other thing...If u decide to switch drugs from one that isn't working for you to another you and your doctor want to try
column2: it was my experience to ween yourself off the first drug a little before starting the new one. I told my doctor about my side affects with Zoloft and he immediately wanted me to start Celexa without getting some of the Zoloft about of my system....HUGE MISTAKE...don't do this...Cut your Zoloft dosage down to almost nothing then start the new one. When he had me just switch from one to the other within a day that really screwed me up. Just a word of advice.

column1: 1412$Condition: Depression$9/24/2009 6:48:43 PM$Reviewer: oldthymegal, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient) $5$5$5$I have been taking Zoloft for 16 years for severe clinical depression
column2: which runs in my family. I was actually contemplating suicide because of my inability to cope with some difficult circumstances. Zoloft literally saved my life. I take 200 mg every evening and do experience some sedation with it
column3: also have had weight gain. But overall
column4: I have had excellent results with this medicine.  Have tried generics - some work pretty well
column5: some don't. They all have different ""fillers"" in them
column6: and some pharmacies (especially the big mail-order one) do tend to buy the cheapest ones. I got one (made by Cobalt out of Canada) that I was actually allergic to.  It also had absolutely no effect as far as controlling my depression - I cried for 2 weeks on it - went back to brand Zoloft and was better in 2 days.  So if you have to take generic for insurance reasons be sure you get it from a reputable pharmacy and ask them what generics they use(there are lots for Zoloft).  When you find one that works for you
column7: ask your doctor to always specify that particular generic when he writes your prescription. Best advice is to get a generic from a US company
column8: as quality control standards are monitored better here. My experience has been that brand Zoloft is best
column9: and it's worth the additional cost if you can manage it. I believe this medicine has been God's way of healing me from depression so that I can live a productive life
column10: and I am grateful for it.    "

25-34 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $3$1$3$"Zoloft undoubtedly works miracles for most users
column3: but there is a dark side under-reported: The creation of ""moodiness"" or bipolar tendencies in those with no history of vulnerability.  Most people who experience the onset of such symptoms may do so mildly
column4: and as the body becomes acclimated
column5: such symptoms may resolve entirely
column6: but it is important for potential users to understand that the first few weeks to months of treatment can force one into a very foreign and unpredictable emotional space that can at least transiently exacerbate the disorder for which the medication was prescribed.  What are the implications of this rough break-in period?  No one knows for sure -- some speculate it is a marker for an intractable withdrawal syndrome to come
column7: others argue that such toxic responses can often signify a future intensification of anxiety or depression
column8: and others merely cross their fingers while savoring whatever favorable emotive tides wash upon them in the short term.  I'm in the latter category. "

column2: 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $4$4$3$"Having dealt with Anxiety
column3: Depression
column4: PTSD
column5: and OCD for the last 10 years -- Zoloft has helped me immensely.  In my experience it starts to alleviate symptoms w/in 1-2 weeks
column6: but finding the correct dosage is critical; too high of a dose tended to promote mania for me.

column2: I tried Paxil for 1 1/2 years but my experience with it at 10-40mg was that Paxil
column3: although effective
column4: made me feel “mentally numb.""

column1: A switch to Zoloft proved to better treat my symptoms without the “numbness.” But I was still symptomatic for 2 years while taking only 100mg.  After an increase to 150mg I felt much better
column2: but had to watch out for manic episodes.

column1: Side effects: these are well documented.  Starting
column2: stopping
column3: increasing/decreasing brings on: ""electric shock"" sensations in arms and legs
column4: waking up frequently at night
column5: clenching one's jaw while sleeping
column6: and disturbing lucid dreams.  At times I felt I was losing my mind
column7: especially when I abruptly stopped taking the medication.  It has been my experience that these side effects abate w/in 2 weeks.

column1: Also to note: for anxiety and mania
column2: caffeine is the devil!!  Switching to decaf was essential to my progress.  Even just one cup o' joe would launch me into major anxiety and/or mania for days.  I can't stress enough how critical this was for me.
they’re a problem.  My gf told me I “needed to have a long talk with Mr. Wiener.”  We broke up.  It helps to have a girlfriend who is supportive
column3: not selfish
column4: about your progress.

column2: Paxil
column3: Effexor) myself.  My wife was placed on Zoloft.  She seemed to have been very happy with it (the subjective experience).  Unfortunately it completely changed her personality.  An intelligent
column4: warm
column5: accomplished woman before
column6: on Zoloft she became narcicistic (even self-worshipping)
column7: unsympathetic
column8: and cold.  And she was happy with her new self.  Professional colleagues commented on her personality change
column9: not just me (her husband).

column2: not ""real""
column3: as in the outside world.

column1: My warning: I am very leary of this medication as a result of how it changed my wife -- and there are plenty of other SSRI drugs out there to choose from.  Personally
column2: I'd avoid it like the plague."

column1: 1615$Condition: Depression$6/5/2009 4:57:37 AM$Reviewer: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient) $2$1$4$"I was prescribed Zoloft at 17. I took it for depression up until a few months ago. I’m turning 32 next week. Just to make that point perfectly clear
column2: that it’s been 15 years.?

column1: I stopped Zoloft for about a year in 2003. At this point
column2: I weaned off of 75mgs over the course of a month. I experienced all the typical withdrawal symptoms (both verified and unverified by the drug companies). These included “brain zaps”
column3: faintness
column4: nausea
column5: severe rage/aggression (almost violent)
column6: crying fits
column7: etc…  The withdrawal symptoms went away after about six months. I noticed that my compulsion to drink alcohol went away (and therefore the weight that I had gained)
column8: as did the zombie feeling. I had been on this for so long that I thought it was all normal! I actually started to feel things again
column9: sans “Garden State”. I actually wanted to experience life.

column2: I had to start taking it again within a year due to unexpected hardships. Within weeks of taking Zoloft again
column3: the zombie like existence returned
column4: as did the compulsion to drink
column5: weight gain
column6: etc. At this point
column7: I realized for the first time that it was the drug that made me feel this way (crazy how it distorts your thinking).

column1: I stayed on Zoloft for another six years because I was terrified of the withdrawal
column2: and what it would do to my job and personal life if I tried to stop again.

column1: I finally stopped taking Zoloft again about a month ago. I suppose being laid off is as good at time as any to kick a bad habit. ? I followed the same process for weaning of it. I had the exact same symptoms as the last time; “brain zaps”
column2: faintness
column3: nausea
column4: severe aggression (almost violent)
column5: crying fits
column6: etc. I’ve been off it for two months now
column7: and I still have all the withdrawal symptoms. I don’t
column8: however
column9: have the “zombified” feeling
column10: compulsion to drink alcohol
column11: negative sexual side effects
column12: or lack of interest in daily activities that used to accompany Zoloft for the last 15 years.

column2: 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient) $5$4$5$"I've been taking Zoloft for over 10 years at 100mg.  It has really helped me with depression which runs in my family.  Here are some things to know:

column1: - Everyone reacts differently.  Just because someone had a negative experience on this board does not mean you will.  I did not experience nausea
column2: anxiety
column3: sleeplessness or lethargy.  Others have.

column1: - Start out slowly.  Your doc should put you on a lower dosage and slowly increase it over time.  This helps your body get used to it with less side effects.
- Be patient...it takes 2-3 weeks to kick in.  So you might not feel any benefit until much later on.
- It doesn't change who you are.  That was my fear.  I didn't want a happy pill.  It did lift my depression so I saw things more clearly.  I am still the same person. However
column2: if you had life problems before this pill won't make them go away.  It will help you to deal with them for effectively by making you functional."

column12: but it has made it bearable and a little brighter.  Hope this helps."

1745$Condition: Bipolar Depression$3/20/2009 9:11:01 AM$Reviewer: ungodly69, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $2$1$5$People with true Bipolar disorder need to use extreme caution when taking a SSRI without mood stabilizers. I was on Zoloft for exactly 4 weeks and at the beginning of the third week, the severe sexual side effects (total loss of interest and decreased ability) were unbearable. This had induced a severe hypomania episode that lasted for days. I had to see my Dr. and have the medication discontinued to stop the mania. This medication also seemed to severely increase my anxiety. My thoughts raced uncontrollably, and they were not good thoughts. This medication works well for DEPRESSION, but will put your mood at the other end of the spectrum (mania) if you're not taking a mood stabilizer at the same time.

column1: 1816$Condition: Depression$2/10/2009 1:02:31 AM$Reviewer: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $5$4$5$"I started on a very low dose (25mg) 6 yrs ago
column2: gradually incr'g the dose over time. (I'm sensitive to medication and was apprehensive to start tx
column3: but so desperate for help
column4: I was willing to try). Soon after starting tx
column5: I developed a constant
column6: low-grade head ache. It differed from the usual type of headache. It was a dull
column7: heavy- feeling of pressure in the front of my head. I actually had the feeling that the drug was working on the part of my brain not functioning properly. I took comfort in that
column8: and actually felt that it was fixing the biochemical ""snafu"" in my head. Once the head ache was gone(usu. lasted 3-7 days.)
column9: I felt fabulous
column10: happy
column11: and peaceful. My initial symptoms returned in 3-4 wks
column12: & my dose was incr'd to 50mg. This pattern repeated itself consistently over the next several mths
column13: w/lenghtening periods of improvement w/each 25mg increase.I stabilized at 100mg/day. I was a calmer
column14: more peaceful
column15: happier individual--no longer suffering from extreme feelings of hopelessness and despair
column16: distractedness
column18: and being agitated at the simplest things. I once again felt happy to be alive
column19: and grateful to be the person I hadn't been in a very
column20: very long time. The neg.side effects I experienced were forgetfulness and wt. gain. Also
column21: during the short-lived ""head ache"" period described above
column22: I also got the ""yawns"" ~6 hrs. after taking medication. After being incr'd to 150mg/day a year and a half after starting tx (my symptoms had started to return
column23: but anxiousness and edginess more so
column25: etc.--caused by sudden job loss & life upheaval)
column26: the forgetfulness became so bad at this higher dose
column27: that I was once driving on a familiar road close to home
column29: it scared me. My Dr. rx'd Wellbutrin XL 150mg to ""lift the fog"" I was experiencing which I took at the same time as zoloft
column31: and soon was no longer forgetful
column32: but sharp-thinking/focused AND a decr'd appetite which resulted in the loss of gained wt.!! "

column1: I started with 25mg/day for the first week and then did 50mg/day for the next 4 weeks. Right now I'm up to 100mg/day. Yes it made me tired after taking it in the morning but I would wake up the next day refreshed. If I took it before I went to bed(50mg) I would wake up dead tired. The good effects about it I can tell it makes me feel a little bit happier and I don't feel as rushed to get in and out of the publics eye. I actually whant to get out some when I have the energy to (side effect is it kills your motivation a bit).
I might try another later as I'm just getting the full effect so we'll see how it goes later. So far the effects are good I'll eventually bump up the doesage."

column2: even compared to other SSRIs.  It took about a month to really start working once I began taking it.  The drug is a very effective libido suppressor but has not caused any other major side effects in use.  However
column3: if you can plan ahead and skip a dose before having sex
column4: one can overcome the libido problem without having adverse effects upon the depression.  Dose reduction and withdrawl does need to be done very slowly
column5: over a period of several months.  When I reduced the dose too fast
column6: I ended up with a bad depressive episode
column7: though I knew why and was able to cope with it. Restoration to the original dose reversed the problem in a few days.  Missing more than a couple of doses in a row also caused some of the strangest dreams I've ever had.  Not bad
column8: just really weird.  Finally
column9: one needs to be careful taking the generic version of this drug.  The first generic version of the drug I took
column10: which looked like the original Zoloft pill
column11: felt like I was taking about 2/3 of my dose.  After switching to a different generic version
column12: a larger oval shaped pill
column13: I had no more problems.  Note that the regular Zoloft pill and both generics were labeled as 100 mg doses.

I could not continue going on with the severity of symptoms I was experiencing. column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $1$1$1$"Zoloft is definatly great for most people

I was on this meidcation from may-oct 2008 and the more I took the med the worse I felt. I had panic attacks that worsened on this medication. I also had morbid or unsettling thoughts and this is not my nature.  When I started crying uncontroloably I had to be hosiptilized.  I had odd or unusualy dreams on the med (i.g. I dreamed I put salt in a washing machine).   I have been on Paxial since october 31
column3: 2008 and today is 12/22/2008.  So far I have been relieved of the panic attacks and my thoughs don't dwell on death or other things.  I also has a friend that had felt like driving over a cliff on this med.  If you have any of the unsettling thoughs please see a certified Phy. not a primary care physcian.  My PCP is great but the truth is she does not specialize in anti-depressents.  With Counseling and taking paxial and Trazidone I feel better for now.  However the debilitating effects of the Zoloft did not hit me for a few months.  God bless.  I hope Zoloft is working for you it is a wonderful drug for most people but not for me."

column1: 2197$Condition: Depression$5/12/2008 8:35:17 PM$Reviewer: $5$4$5$"I have been taking Vitamin Z for a year and a half

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$5$4$"Been taking Zoloft about 5 weeks. The first week was HORRIBLE. I had anxiety about the anti-anxiety medicine!! I was afraid of how it would make me feel
column3: would I feel like a zombie
column4: would I feel like myself still??

column2: no appetite
column3: dizzy
column4: burning sensation in my neck and shoulders. Didn't know if I could continue sticking with it but could not go back to the panic attacks. So I stuck with it and am SO glad I did.

column1: Most of the side effects were gone after two weeks. And I have not had a panic attack in a month! I still feel like myself. My Dr. prescribed 50mg for 1 week then 100mg after that. Still on just 50mg
column2: don't feel like I need 100mg and Dr. was OK with that.

column1: The remaining side effects are minimal. Sometimes it's hard for me to sleep
column2: my memory isn't as sharp as it was before
column3: my sex drive was decreased but is back to normal now (boyfriend happy about that!) and that's about it. I am scared of it wearing off like I heard it could do
column4: also I'm scared about having to take it forever but that could be the anxiety talking. It works great for me now and I'm not taking that for granted! I love enjoying life again!

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $5$5$5$"DAY 12 of taking 1 zoloft (50 mg) and 2 xanax (.25 mg one in the morning one before bed) a day. it's helped my mood so far. when i first started taking it i had no appetite but i would still be hungry...and then i couldn't eat and i'd get shaky and nervous...and sick but the last couple of days have been awesome. the side effects are less severe...actually i don't really think i have any at all...i was always tired before i went on the meds anyway so i can't really blame the drowsiness on zoloft. i guess you could say i'm more relaxed...i'm sleeping better...eating more..my fiance notices how much more energy i have to do the things i use to love doing. i have an appt with my therapist on monday so i'm going to tell him how it's helped me so far...i still get upset about things but not as angry as i would before i started taking anti depressants. i just let things go...i don't think i've argued with my fiance all week actually... i don't want to get too excited yet and say "" YES!! IT'S WORKING FOR ME! I'M GONNA BE FINE!!! YAYY!!!)...no no no i'm going to wait until it's been a month or so so i can figure out if this stuff is right for ME. i think if i were to just be taking zoloft without the xanax i'd be sick from side effects....and it would not help my mood at all. it's addicting so i only take 2 a day...sometimes 1. my therapist will not refill the Rx for my xanax so...i don't want to get use to them and have to go through the withdrawls..but so far i think i'll be ok for now."
65-74 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$1$5$Zoloft was great in relieving my clinical depression
column3: and I took it for several years.  After awhile
column4: it stopped being quite as effective & my dosage was increased. That's when the trouble started.  I developed a tremor in my hands so bad that my finger was constantly tapping the mouse when I was using the computer.  This I could live with
column5: but I developed the most bizarre behavior when I went to bed.  As my muscles were beginning to relax
column6: I would have around 30 minutes of what seemed like grand mal seizures...except that I was awake and conscious.  All limbs and neck would jerk violently...and I couldn't control it.  I just learned to lay there and take it with humor...sorta like some sort of bizarre amustment park ride for 30 minutes.  Weird.  Also restless leg syndrome got extremely bad....I'd try to not move when the urge hit
column7: and after a few seconds
column8: my leg would jerk violently...like nerve synapses were shooting out electrical signals and my muscles HAD to respond to them.  My Dr switched me to Lexapro
column9: and the tremor is gone as are the seizure-like jerking.  I still have restless leg syndrome
column10: but it has greatly diminished in severity.  Lexapro seems to work as well as the Zoloft on depression symptoms
column11: as well.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $3$3$5$I've already posted on here..kinda like a journal thingy to me...this day # 3 of being on Zoloft and Xanax. I felt fine when i woke up this morning. After taking a Xanax before bed last night i was relaxed and happy and i slept like a baby. but when i took 1 Zoloft after i got to work this morning (around 9 a.m.) i started to feel sick to my stomach and had no appetite what-so-ever. i was miserable and i felt like crying. this last pretty much all day until my afternoon break at 2 o'clock. even though i had no appetite i did manage to force myself to eat some toast and plain potato chips...and some sprite to sip on. And now it's almost 3 and i feel completely fine (eating M&M's). earlier i wouldn't have been able to look at food.. I can understand why some people would complain of weight loss if you feel like you're about to throw up when you try to chew something and swallow it. but you have to. small snacks help. crackers...chips...anything like that i have to force myself to eat and i always feel better afterwards. thank god today is friday so i can deal with the side effects at home this weekend. i'm ready for this stuff to kick in...i don't know which is worse...feeling like i did before the meds or the way i feel now. it also doesn't help that i have a cough/cold and i'm PMS-ing!!!! hope this helps someone so they at least know what to expect. after the side effects go away i forget how sick i was and it's so easy for someone to make me laugh
column3: until they start to come back. even if you can't eat...DO IT! i've heard more good things about this drug than bad...so i'm going to give it a try...unless i know for sure it's hopeless or my side effects get worse. i know this drug isn't for everyone.

19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $5$4$5$"I started on Zoloft when I was finally treated for my depression after suffering for 11 years.  My sypmtoms included having trouble remembering details/thoughts
column3: headaches
column4: tiredness
column5: anxiety about what people thought of me
column6: and trouble putting myself in large group settings (I'm a very outgoing person).  I was also in a very difficult marriage and was contemplating leaving.  The first two weeks of Zoloft were awful.  I had horrible headaches
column7: pain all over my brain.  I was tired but could not sleep.  I took the pill with milk
column8: but I was hungry and could not eat. I also experienced increased brain activity
column9: where it was almost as though I could feel ""energy"" in my head...hard to describe.  Additionally I remember a few nights where the sleeplessness caused me to feel suicidal
column10: I had almost evil thoughts
column11: ""maybe I would be better off dead""
column12: ""why am I here""...  I took off work for these two weeks (highly recommended) and luckily I was blessed with a mentor who had been through anti-deppressants and he constantly brought me back to reality.  Once I went to my prescribed dose (50mg--I had been taking half-pills for a few days) the symptoms got much less drastic
column13: but I still struggled with sleeping.  I found a small fountain of water next to my bed helped.  It is now a year and half later and I am doing amazing
column14: I feel like I have my life back!  I cannot imagine going off of this medication as I am much more present in my life.  I have noticed some possible sexual side effects
column15: as it is harder for me to experience orgasm.  I worry about pregnancy and breastfeeding and having to make those decisions
column16: but I am very happy on Zoloft.  I will say if you are not happy or if your side effects persist
column17: try something else!  This is such a hit/miss drug as I know those who are successful with it and some that hate it.  Also

2360$Condition: Panic Disorder$1/26/2008 11:44:44 PM$Reviewer: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $5$4$5$I began to experience panic attacks a few years ago that felt like I was having a heart attack.  I was prescribed Zoloft to try and it has been a life saver.  After the initial week of getting used to the drug I found that my attacks have completely stopped and I can actually sleep at night.  I did experience a gradual weight gain my first round but on my second I have been losing weight.  A good part of this is due to exercise and diet.  There are side effects but very small.  The most prominent one is probably the loss of extreme emotions that I used to feel.  I feel very much contained and it's not too bad.  I would rather have limits on my emotions than to go back having severe panic attacks.  I cannot thank Zoloft enough.  I had been off it for 5 months and weaned just fine, but realized that the stress in my life got to be too much.  I recommend seeking counseling along with the drug, but certainly try Zoloft if you experience what I have.

column3: I stopped.  The side effects were awful
column4: I was tired
column5: irritable
column6: and just couldn't function at work.  My body had a strange tingling feeling and I felt like I could urinate my pants at anytime. These side effects pushed my anxiety over the edge.

column2: I certainly can see we all have different metabolisms--thats why it's important to have a trustworthy and competent dr. overseeing ones treatment. A chemical imbalance is ultimately responsible for a lot of our symptoms. Apprehension about seeking help is our 1st hurdle. We shouldn't let a bad experience with any (1) drug or type of drug deter us from finding relief.  I myself
column3: need to change my medication usually annually. (apparently I build up a tolerance). As I sense it happening
column4: I freely and openly discuss with my personal physician and we either have tried a different med. or upped dosage at times. Over the last 8yrs. we have found that going back and forth between Paxil and Zoloft works best for my metabolism. Prozac and Climadyn weren't well tolerated (got worse).

column2: in conclusion
column3: I like to say don't give up--you don't have to live life being depressed
column4: anxious etc.. but it may take a few tries to find what chemical may be active
column5: inactive
column6: overactive in your system.

column2: 25-34 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $1$1$1$"Back in 1994
column3: only ONE PILL of Zoloft created a 3-day living nightmare for me.  First hour: onset of tremors and fear. Second hour: nausea
column4: panic. By the fourth hour
column5: (I was 19 at the time) I was staying at my father's home.  I couldn't sleep. Roughly around midnight
column6: something snapped in my head. I lost my sense of identity. I didn't know who I was
column7: where I was
column8: etc.  I used logic to get help:  Assuming I was in a living room with a TV on and it was midnight
column9: the owner(s) of the house would most likely be upstairs sleeping.  I went to the first door (luckily my father's bedroom) and knocked.  When he answered
column10: I distinctly remember saying
column11: ""Excuse me Sir
column12: but I don't know who I am
column13: where I am
column14: or how I got here
column15: but I'm scared.""

column2: took me down to the living room and he tried talking to me.  By 6am
column3: I started shaking and couldn't stop touching my face/forehead/head (sense of connectivity through anxiety situations).  Father called hospital and doctor. They said there was nothing to do but stop any further usage
column4: and wait it out.

column2: I regained my identity
column3: but had horrible diarhea and tremors and panic.

column2: I felt I would never feel happiness again and said
column3: ""Now I understand why people commit suicide. If they felt like they would never feel another moment of happiness again
column4: it makes sense.""

column1: I distinctly remember I asked if I could have a box of Kleenex and sit on the front porch (summertime) and I cried unexplainably for 6 HOURS NON-STOP!

It took 3 days before I felt it was out of my system. I felt as though certain ""doors inside the innermost parts of my brain were unlocked and opened; doors that were never meant to be opened. Ever.""
I've never been the same since that paradoxical reaction from that ONE SINGLE PILL.  I never will willingly take an anti-depressant again.
My treatment for GAD since 1995 has been Librium when I wake up and Propranolol (for its beta-blocking properties) 20mg every 4 or 5 hours."
